page.title: 04River Medway Part 1
page.content: The river{Medway}is a major influence on the lives of the surrounding villages. To regulate the flow of the river the{Leigh Flood Barrier}was built. The flood barrier was built to stop floods in Tonbridge because they were very drastic. In 1968 there was a terrible flood when water came up to the first windows and up to the engines of the buses. The barrier took a long time to build because they had to ask Lord de L'Isle for his permission to flood the land. It was opened in 1981, and it has been used seven times since then. When they close the barrier to stop Tonbridge getting flooded, Penshurst gets flooded instead. It does not matter too much for our village because we have countryside, but Tonbridge is a big town with shops. {continued on page 5
